intro: Vachellia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Vachellia chiapensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
